Sentencas: Composite electrolytes of sodium carbonate and samarium doped ceria (SDC-Na2CO3) provide outstanding proton conductivity between 300 degree celsius and 650 degree celsius, which is extremely sensitive to the synthesis procedure and to the amount and crystallinity of the carbonate phase.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: Here, the role of sodium carbonate in establishing the composite conductivity is explored in relation to chemical-structural and morphological characterization methods (ICP, XRD, SEM, TEM).
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: A coprecipitation route is properly optimized to prepare composites with <50 nm SDC particles with sodium carbonate in different amounts.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: The amount of carbonate, carefully quantified via elemental analysis, strongly influences the proton conductivity, while the oxygen ion conductivity is much less affected.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: The formulation with 27 wt% of carbonate prepared through a single-step synthesis shows the best performance, with 2.27*10(-2)
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: S cm(-1) proton conductivity in dry hydrogen (4 % H-2 in N-2) at 600 degree celsius, and 1.73*10(-2)
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: S cm(-1) oxygen ion conductivity in air.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: Interestingly, an SDC-Na2CO3 composite containing the same salt amount but produced via a double-step procedure showed lower conductivity, confirming the pivotal role of the preparation methodology in defining the composite proton conductivity.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: In addition, humidification is found to depress H+ conductivity, thus indicating that the preferential charge transport mechanism does not involve hydroxides, in contrast to conventional protonic ceramics.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications

Sentencas: Overall, the investigation reveals a strong dependence of the composite proton conductivity on the density of the carbonate/SDC interfaces and the crystallinity of the carbonate.
Titulo: Role of carbonate amount and synthesis procedure in the conductivity of SDC-Na2CO3 composite electrolytes for solid oxide cells applications
